entries.name: Heightened Mana
entries: Whenever you cast a spell using a spell slot of higher level, you may reroll all of its damage dice once. You must use the new roll.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The Guitu are a nomadic tribe of Humans, that reside in Shiv, in the world of Dominaria. Many sages, Wizards, and other wise and intelligent people come from their ranks. You're one of its many prodigies. Could you polish your skills to become one of its geniuses?

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I idolize a particular genius of my tribe, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
I idolize a particular genius of my tribe, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
Sometimes, I wish I could come back to my people, but I fear I will not find them anymore among the heat of the mountains.
I love telling other people about my discoveries, If they also love to listen is really none of my concern..
Everything can be summed up with a mathematical equation. I just need to find its result.
I am intolerant of ignorant people, and won't respect anyone that believes in things that cannot be proven.
In my nomadic lifestyle, I've never seen anything high end. Now that I've had a taste of the city life, I don't ever want to go back.
No matter what the spell is, I must know everything about it. Who came up with it, how it is cast, and how it can be used in different situations.

entries.caption: Ideal
rows: Control. I will not share my discoveries with anyone that cannot use them objectively and without bias. (Lawful)
Evolution. With everything I have researched, I will make sure that, no matter what kind of magic, it will be used to improve the world around me. (Good)
Freedom. No spell should be confined to a single use, it's my job to uncover all kinds of ways to use them. (Chaotic)
Study. I will research and collect as much as I can from Mana. People may do with my findings as they best see fit, as long as I get my rewards. (Neutral)
Power. With this much knowledge about the inner workings of Mana, any Wizard would bend to my will for even a drop of what I uncovered. (Evil)
Wanderlust. Now that I'm finally out of my tribe, anything is possible. (Any)

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: My parents remained in the tribe after I left, and I would do anything for them.
My professor once gifted me with a trinket to remember them. I carry it with me where I go.
I made friends with a Shivan Dragon, deep within the rugged hills of my nation. We long to share stories with each other again.
Those who follow my studies are what keep me going.
I have built a place for education, and plan to return to it once I've made a breakthrough.
My tome carries all my research. I can never let it out of my sight.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: My equations are simple, and anyone that can't follow doesn't deserve my attention.
I put too much trust in those with an educational position higher than mine.
Sometimes, I fail to understand the feelings of a situation, only the facts.
I'm completely lost without my notes.
Anyone might be a potential spy, trying to steal the research I painstakingly put together.
If I am not working on my research, then I am wasting my time. Period.

boon.name: Boon of Incandescent Days
entries: {@note {@b Received by:} Extreme devotion to Glarius.}

They burn like the distant stars. Their resolve never falters; not even once do they sway in their path. Similar to a conflagration, they cannot be reasoned with. Those touched by the sun are unyielding. Fortunately for us, they are men of health. If that obsession was turned to a flame's destruction... Well, let's not dwell in that thought.
When you receive damage from a melee attack, your attacker takes 2d8 fire damage.

items: Bleeding is a condition generally caused by weapons that present {@u serrated}, besides some other means, opening irregular wounds in enemies, that deal constant damage because of the blood loss.

Bleeding comes in three ways, those being Light, Medium and Severe. Each one has a different additional damage table, however, they are proportional. Each time a creature fails its resistence check against bleed ( A Constitution saving throw, Light = 10, Medium = 15, Severe = 20+ ), its level increases, with a max of three levels.
Bleeding can be interrupted if the bleeding creature receives any kind of cure. If a Medicine check is made, the DC to interrupt bleeding is the same as the saving throws.

hazard.name: Celestial Distortion

entries: {@i In ages past, we assimilated these things to the beasts below, or to the unaligned realms. The vile sickness, the festering rot, the embodiments of hatred that all Fiends brought... are now harbinged by the Heavens above.}

Whenever a character enters a territory affected by celestial distortion, they must resist a DC 25 Constitution saving throw for every minute they spend within the area. If they succeed, they are immune to the effects of celestial distortion for the next hour. If they fail, they begin to distort and break away, their ungodly bodies unable to resist the divine grace present within. Refer to the table below regarding the effects of celestial distortion:

items: 1st failure: You automatically gain 3 points of exhaustion. Your skin starts to break away and crack like a pot, but instead of flesh, blood and sinew below, there will be stars, cosmos, and galaxies.

2nd failure: You automatically gain 2 points of exhaustion, as well as becoming blinded, deafened and charmed. Devotion will fill your heart, and the worship of the gods will be the only thing that comes to mind while you vomit out blood and stars. You gain the following character trait: ''My life is only for the benefit of the gods. I will sacrifice myself for them, their will be done through me.''

3rd failure: You gain 1 more point of exhaustion, and as you die, you are immediately revived as an Eidolon (monster stat block chosen by the DM), and made to guard the divine region you once desecrated. Your character retains few key memories of their past life, yet cannot act upon it, constantly muttering whispers and echoes of what they once were.

entries: Pilgrims and characters of true faith have advantage on their saving throw. For each deed done and acknowledged in the name of the gods' wishes, the saving throw DC is diminished by 2.
Evil-aligned characters automatically fail their saving throws.
{@note Celestial distortion can be found in all temples that belonged to Faiths of the old world, as well as in places that had or still have a large amount of divine influence.}

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the redfin hammersnout moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The redfin hammersnout has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The redfin hammersnout makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hammer snout.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hammer Snout
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals double damage to objects and structures.

Redfin Hammersnouts are the bane of any beginning sailor. Every good fish collector in Hope Harbor knows you need to bring with you a few armed men or a very good harpoon to fend off those nasty creatures. Corrupted by the blood in the seas and the evil in the air, when those fish aren't eating, they're destroying any folk-made things they can get their snouts on.

Buoys are seldom seen in the Flesh Sea, because redfin hammersnouts make it their life goal to get rid of anything they see on the water surface. Digestible or not, they smash and eat turtles and boats, children and sailors.

Despite their violent nature, experienced crews easily kill any that try to damage their hulls, and snout fillet is known to keep sailors healthy and satisfied. The rumors that you can taste the evil in their meat have no scientific validation, but many travelers still eat them with that intent, believing they'll become stronger and more vicious the more of the flesh they consume.
When not spreading chaos and destruction, redfin hammersnouts tend to hunt turtles, their favorite food. They also happen to be hunted by anything larger than them, as is the way of the Flesh Sea.

trait.name: Blood Cravings
entries: The wharf rat has advantage on perception checks against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wharf rat has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage and the target falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Water Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 / 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Wharf Rats are well known for climbing into ships through holes they make with their sharp teeth. If the supplies of food and drink have been diminishing exponentially faster than they should be, it's very likely Wharf Rats are behind all of it.

Once, these creatures became the mascot of the Flesh Sea, and people willing to clear the bad name of their port tried selling them as pets for the unaware. Unfortunately, these beasts are uncontrollable, and after several incidents where the buyers had their faces eaten off, selling wharf rats became prohibited. Which, in the Flesh Sea, just means they're more expensive. In the end, they really did bring in a profit.

Wharf Rats are omnivorous, and will eat practically anything they can get their teeth on. Despite not having many natural predators, they're usually consumed by anything larger than them, which is very common in that part of the ocean, or by pirates in search of revenge. We recommend taking them with lemon and gravy, but don't eat the tail, it's tough and rubbery.

action.name: Change Shape (Couatl)
entries: The Pink Scoundrel can use its action to polymorph into a handsome man shape or back into its true form as a pink dolphin. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
In dolphin form he can only attack with kicks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. 1 target. {@h} 8({@dice 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: Melee  Attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft, 1 target. {@h} 4 bludgeoning damage.
On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity check. If they fail, they become {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hypnotic Eyes
entries: Once per day, Pink Scoundrel can cast the spell {@spell command|PHB}. The DC is 20.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The pink scoundrel can breathe air and water.
{@i “Good morning, I would like to know if you, beautiful madam, is married.”}
— Prettysea, a famous Pink Scoundrel, to an innocent victim of his charms.

"Of all the creatures I've ever encountered, this is probably the friendliest, most irritating, and most dangerous at the same time. The Pink Scoundrels live in flocks of males, since there are no females of their kind. They leave their bands near port cities where they seduce women, with a preference for the married ones, and impregnate them with another Pink Scoundrel baby.

It is worth mentioning that they are against any kind of magical use to seduce women and consider it immoral, sentencing those who do so to death. More decent than the stories that angry fathers and husbands tell, huh?" — W.T.

trait.name: Bushwack
entries: As a reaction when hit by a ranged attack, the seed of regress may have the projectile pass right through it, leaving behind a trail of leaves and flower petals.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The seed of regress has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Natural Camouflage.
entries: When the seed of regress stands still, it is indistinguishable from a bush or a tuft of grass, unless you are proficient in the Animal Handling skill or you are versed in knowledge regarding nature Elementals.

trait.name: Nature's Touch
entries: After staying still in the same place for more than a minute, if the seed of regress is not {@condition unconscious}, it may choose to slowly spread out grass and flowers in a five foot area around it. For each minute that passes, this area extends five feet more to all sides. This area does not ignore walls or buildings. After it has extended over thirty feet, fruit trees may start growing as well.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage.

{@i "I am not concerned by how cute they are, I am concerned by the constant threat they present to the maintenance of important highways and buildings. No, we will not look into selling them as pets. This is final."}
— Demain, C.E.S Head Researcher of Infusions

Seeds of regress are the offspring of Eden, the Primal Element that resides over nature. These silly animals are quite friendly to all other creatures, eager to play with any that give them the time of day. Seeds of regress are fast friends and vegetarians, following anyone that gives them sweet fruits.

Well, mostly anyone. Somehow, they have a knack for recognizing C.E.S. employees and will run from them as soon as they set their sights on them. Seeds of regress are quite fast and hard to catch, prompting C.E.S. to fund a division of specialists focused on capturing them.

Seeds of regress are attracted to centers of development and technology, nestling somewhere inside and allowing their gardens to expand, which tends to destroy any machinery found within the growing vines and foliage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.
Common lowlifes that infest the roads of Glarus County, taking advantage of the steady flow of refugees and adventurers that travel the lands, looking for any coin or valuable they can salvage.

trait.name: Get 'em while they're down!
entries: Masked Bandits take advantage of fallen enemies, finishing them off while they are on the ground. When attacking a target that is {@condition prone}, the Masked Bandit can add {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to its damage roll, if the attack hits.

Crafty bandits that help their companions by building traps on roads and knocking down their targets with the use of sturdy ropes attached to their arrows. Dangerous enemies in a full group, but almost useless on their own.

trait.name: Put'em to The Ground!
entries: Masked Bandit Archers use roped arrows that, when successfully hit, they use to pull their enemies down. If it hits an enemy with a ranged attack, the Masked Bandit Archer can use a bonus action to unbalance the target, that has to succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blindfire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 0} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Broken Broadsword.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Photosynthesis
entries: If the Asteralian Soldier is under direct sunlight, it regains 4 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Boon
entries: If the Asteralian Soldier is under direct sunlight, it has advantage on its attack rolls.

trait.name: Emergency Rations.
entries: When the hit points of the Asteralian Soldier reach half of its total hit points, it will use its action to dash towards the nearest Corvian in the vicinity, if there is one.

Corpse that cheated the Cycle of Everything, turned into a wandering mass of sunflowers. These plants grew out of corpses of old soldiers, wearing their armor and grabbing any piece of equipment they can find in order to stand their ground.
Decent foes while under sunlight, these yellow soldiers are not as impressive when coated by darkness, slowly withering away in the shadows.
Mass of roots that took over loose pieces of armor and weapons. For a Green Corpse, these transformed knights seem to be quite resourceful when it comes to fighting.

Rooted Knights are nothing more than puppets. The real threat lies above, a bulbous pile of corpses that refuse to continue the Cycle of Everything, growing in size and expanding its tainted roots all around them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Rooted Knight makes one Entangling Roots attack and one Straight Sword attack.

action.name: Entangling Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. The Rooted Knight extends the roots from the head of its armor towards a target and, on a hit, the target becomes {@condition grappled} (STR escape {@dc 14}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends.

action.name: Straight Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Rooted Connection
entries: All Rooted Knights are physically connected to a Rooted Corpse Mass so, if the Mass dies, the Rooted Knights connected to it also die.

trait.name: Roots on the Ceiling
entries: Rooted knights are connected to the ceiling of structures, below a Rooted Corpse Mass. Rooted Knights cannot enter areas with no ceilings present or that are more than 60 ft. apart from the Rooted Corpse Mass it is connected to.

trait.name: Extend Roots
entries: If in a corridor (max. 15 ft. wide) during combat, the Rooted Knight can extend roots from its back to close off the corridor as an action. It can only extend 5 ft. to each side, and only two sides at a time. While this ability is active, the Knight's speed is 0.

trait.name: Hollow Mimicry
entries: The deathseeker can eerily copy voices that it has heard within the past day, and any of the voices of those that it has watched die. A wisdom (Insight) check with your spell save DC reveals that the sound is false.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The deathseeker does not provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Passing Gaze
entries: The Deathseeker's eyes can magically sense the presence of dead bodies and undead creatures within 120 ft of itself, where their see through their surroundings as if they were transparent, highlighting only the general shapes of any bodies as if they were blurs of shadow, their race and size being distinguishable, It may use this action an amount of times equal to its caster's proficiency modifier, regaining its uses at night

action.name: Reminisce
entries: The Deathseeker can peer into a body thats at least a week fresh, connecting the traces of its soul to form an illusory recollection of the dead's last moments, to a max of 5 minutes before their passing. To peer into a dead creatures soul, the Deathseeker performs a minute-long ritual to do so, and can then perform the same ritual without seeing the body, having memorized it.
Saving throw reminder : Add casters proficiency bonus to their
dex and wis saving throws and stealth skill.

“I miss mom and dad, it's been a while since they passed, three years. At first, I was terrified. Sickness, thought that the slow death would come creep up on me as well but... In time i learnt to appreciate it, you see? Here, let me help you see. Look at their faces... They were peaceful as they went.”
— A young Deathseeker reminiscing of memories now grown fond.

Corpse that cheated the Cycle of Everything, turned into a wandering mass of peonies. These plants grew out of corpses of old sergeants, wearing their heavy armor and grabbing massive swords in order to defend their positions.

Although their ranks are easily recognizable by their equipment, these mindless flowers are far from leaders on battlefields. Still, the warmth of the Sun seems to make their strikes almost as powerful as any worthy knight.

trait.name: Photosynthesis
entries: If the Peonian Sergeant is under direct sunlight, it regains 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) hit points at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Boon
entries: If the Asteralian Soldier is under direct sunlight, it has advantage on its attack rolls.

trait.name: Slow Reflexes
entries: Peonian Sergeants move and react slowly due to their heavy equipment, thus, they can't make opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Stance
entries: The Peonian Sergeant uses its action to hold its sword upwards. If its next attack hits a target, add 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage to the damage roll.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

Corpse that cheated the Cycle of Everything, taking the appearance of an old log, or perhaps a dying shrub, even. Unremarkable in all aspects, seeing one moving fills the observer with disgust and sadness.
Perhaps it is a curse, after all, as these moving trunks seem to still keep an expression of utter horror and distress. "Listen closely, could it be weeping?"

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Branching Corpse remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead shrub.

action.name: Rusted Axe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spiky Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Disciple of Saint Heulwen

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Disciple of Saint Heulwen casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Aura of Blisters
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the Disciple of Saint Heulwen, the disciple can force that creature to make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage and becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours, only takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Break of Dawn
entries: Once the Disciple of Saint Heulwen falls to half their hit points, they will utilize their Spark of the Everlasting Star to transform into a Knight of Incandescent Days. The disciple must spend an action to channel the power of the flame into their very soul, and if succesful, they will recover {@dice 8d6} hit points, recover their legendary resistances, as well as gain access to the Incandescent table of traits and actions.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Disciple of Saint Heulwen fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mount.
entries: If the Disciple of Saint Heulwen isn't mounted, they can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as their mount, provided the disciple and their mount are on the same plane of existence. When they teleport, the disciple appears astride the mount along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying.

While mounted and not {@condition incapacitated}, the disciple can't be surprised, and both it and its mount have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. If the disciple is reduced to 0 hit points while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 hit points as well.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The disciple of saint heulwen has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the disciple of saint heulwen's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The disciple makes three attacks with its ashen blade or two attacks with its bolt of cinders.

action.name: Ashen Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) fire damage ( plus 23 {@damage 5d8} fire damage).

action.name: Bolt of Cinders
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the disciple's next turn.

legendary.name: Glarius's Weapons ( Trait )
entries: The knight's weapon attacks are magical. When the knight hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} fire damage (included in the attack).

legendary.name: Flyby ( Trait )
entries: The knight doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when they fly out of an enemy's reach.

legendary.name: Phoenix Wings ( Trait )
entries: The knight gains a pair of Phoenix wings, allowing them to dash faster and to gain a flying speed equal to double their current speed. The knight may consume one of their wings to recover {@dice 8d6} hit points, but lose half of their flying speed. If the knight consumes both wings, it loses their flying speed.

legendary.name: Trailblazer ( Trait )
entries: The knight can Dash as a bonus action. Whenever they do so, they leave behind a trail of fire that lasts until the start of their next turn. Any creature that starts its turn or walks through the trail must make a {@dc 19} dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6 } fire damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Multiattack ( Action )
entries: The disciple makes three attacks with their ignited heart or causes two Blazes.

legendary.name: Ignited Heart
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., two targets. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage. Any creature hit by this attack must make a {@dc 19} dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition grappled}, and may reroll the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a succesful save, the creature is not {@condition grappled}, and is immune to this effect for 24 hours

legendary.name: Blazing Truth
entries: The trails the knight left behind ignite, and anyone within 5 ft. of them must make a {@dc 19} dexterity saving throw and take {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Falling Star
entries: The knight launches themselves upwards, leaving behind a smoldering crater. Then, they fall upon a creature of their choice that they can see which was in a distance of 30 ft. of them before they flew. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 5d12}) fire damage and become {@condition restrained} and {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature only takes half the damage and doesn't suffer any conditions.

legendaryHeader: When transformed into a Knight of Incandescent Days, the Disciple gains access to the following actions and traits.

entries: There are two types of disciples: those chosen by the gods as faithful mortal acolytes, which were ascended to lead the worship of those divine beings together with the saints of their faith; and those that have been created by their gods to serve as their angels and sentinels, refusing to gift such a position to ungrateful traitors and their descendants. Disciples tend to roam the lands of Alacritas, applying their celestial blessings as the holy will of their masters permits so, but it is said a congregation of each faith is safekeeping the Curses that poison our land.

Disciples of Saint Heulwen follow Glarius, the goddess of fire, sun and health. Sometimes referred to as the pitiful goddess, she took in as many as she could of the most faithful of her followers after the Night of Folly. She removed their hearts, and inserted a piece of the very sun into them.
That distant star used to carry so much warmth with it... And its shine was golden... But no longer. And it is their fault this is so.
The Kingdom of Lucinia offers a hefty reward for any that may collect and bring to them their sacred flames.

trait.name: False Appearence
entries: While the Yavimaya sojourner remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The vine can constrict only one target at a time.

action.name: Entangling Vines
entries: The Yavimaya Sojourner can animate normal vines and roots on the ground in a 15-foot square within 30 feet of it. These plants turn the ground in that area into difficult terrain. A creature in that area when the effect begins must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by entangling vines and roots. A creature {@condition restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength (Athletics) check, freeing itself on a successful check. The effect ends after 1 minute or when the Yavimaya Sojourner dies or uses Entangling Vines again.
{@i To the long-lived treefolk, the Phyrexians invading again after only three centuries was as though they never left.}

Yavimaya's consciousness will never cease fighting — not even its trees are willing to give up on the combat. Yavimaya sojourners are conscious Yavimayan trees that patrol its territory in order to protect it from any unwelcome trespassers.

action.name: Burn
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flamibbal sheds dim-light in a 20-foot radius.
A small balloon of fire that feasts on the unaware adventurers flame.
When least expected, inside a dark and perilous cavern, this flaming blur moves in high velocity, screeching and stealing the fire in their torch.

trait.name: Bad Flier.
entries: The Great Frilled Cockatrice falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

trait.name: Partial Petrification.
entries: Whenever the Great Frilled Cockatrice deals damage with its Claw attack or Bite attack, the hit creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or have a limb partially {@condition petrified} for {@dice 1d4 + 2} rounds, the DM may choose the limb attacked or roll a {@dice d4}, odd results in a leg being {@condition petrified}, even results in an arm being {@condition petrified}. If the character has wings or other appendages, they may also be {@condition petrified}, applying the results as appropriate.
A {@condition petrified} leg results in a cummulative halving of the characters walk speed.
A {@condition petrified} arm makes its corresponding hand count as occupied, and the creature takes a -2 penalty to any rolls relating to using that arm.

If the Great Frilled Cockatrice deals 30 or more damage using either its Claw or BIte attacks to one creature in one turn, the creature must instead make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, or be fully {@condition petrified} until it is cured. This means of petrification counts as a curse.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The Great Frilled Basillisk makes two Claw attacks, two Tail attacks or one Claw attack and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) slashing damage plus Partial Petrification.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus Partial Petrification.

action.name: Petrifying Flaunt
entries: The Cockatrice flares its frills, screeching wildly as rampant mana explodes around it. All creatures in a 20-ft radius centered at the cockatrice must make a DC 16 constitution saving throw or be {@condition petrified} for one minute..

action.name: Self-Preserved Stone
entries: The Great Frilled Cockatrice petrifies itself for at least one round. All effects of petrification apply normaly when {@condition petrified} like this, when this duration is over, it may use its reaction to perform a Petrifying Flaunt.

Eh? Whazzat'? Why there are no foxes around? Heh, y'see partner, thing is... None of us here take it kind to thieves of no kind, and all o' those vixens tend to go for the poor foul on the prowl.. Let's say we got a hand from a little guild here, and any foxy individual gets their due when they mess with the chicks.
entries.by: Joel Joson, Owner of Joel's Farm.

entries: The Great Frilled Cockatrice is the usual Cockatrices meaner, badder cousin. Highly territorial and fiercely violent, these monstrosities make their nests in the driest parts of forests and near any poor farmers home, preferring places far from settlements and with harsher predators, which they often jaunt with to stabilish dominance.

A Frilled Cockatrice's eyes are made from pure stone, rendering it blind to the world, but it is able to locate its immediate surroundings by the vibrations in the soil using innate magic rooted deep within them, a magic so powerful that it leaks around the Cockatrice as it grows, enlarging their frills and turning them dry and hard, much like stone itself, along with leaving them infused with this mana.
Arcanist's Cookbook Entry #1940 FRILLY MANTLES AND SIGHTLY AMULETS.

As any artificing arcanist knows, the remains of fell monsters are nothing IF the perfect materials for anything! As such, today we bring you the best recipes to turn that ugly chicken into beautiful magic items!

The first item is the Lithomic Mantle, made out of the full weight of collected Cockatrice Frills, lending whomever dons them the ability to pertify themselves at will, much like the nasty monsters, or even wake up their innert mana to send a shower of petrifying light! Nasty!

The second is simply the extracted Stone Eye of Cockatrice, the fountain of stony magics, a magnificent component for spells such as Flesh to Stone, Stoneskin and Stoneshape, and it's even being used to test out some new formulas attempting to simulate the beast's signature skill!

And third, but not least, is an use for the same item as before! If crushed down, any seasoned Runesmith is able to use its dust to mark down an arm with a Rune of Petrification, causing any stab, slash or gash of a weapon to fester stones into the wounds, just like the Cockatrice's claws!

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Concealment
entries: While in contact with its web, the glittering spider is considered {@condition invisible}, as the threads consume light, obscuring their position.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Golden Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) radiant damage and have the next attack made against it be with advantage.

action.name: Dark Thread
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage and be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.
Gardium, then, approached the twins, hiding something behind his back: A gift! To mark the birth of this world and the aspects of the Queen of Dawn and the Empress of Dusk!

Linolium and Dumosia stared at the being, amazed. The eight-legged creature moved its fangs with joy, dripping droplets of the purest light from them, while storing endless threads of unimaginable darkness in its abdomen.
And Amarantia hugged the tiny beast, bringing it into existence, to inhabit the endless web of caverns Tenufia created on the land.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The celestial eagle has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Sky Blue Feathers
entries: If flying during a clear day, the eagle is considered {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Magical Legacy
entries: The eagle's melee attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The celestial eagle makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

When the last Colossus fled, the eagles remained, as they could not abandon their eggs, and although the troops were unable to tame the beasts, they became the kingdom's symbol, to mark the last memory of the ancient giants and the victory of Zurzach over its oldest foe.

Rafwyn is a young illusionist with unruly brown hair who has studied at the Tolarian Academy. He is the son of Aron Capashen, who was the head of the highest house of Benalia, and the younger brother of Danitha Capashen. Despite his noble heritage, he prefers to go by the name of "Raff".

In the two years since joining the crew, Raff has grown into the role of ship's mage, shedding his youthful boasting — but not his sense of humor. During the New Phyrexian invasion of Dominaria, he has helped his crew smuggle valuable information and supplies across Phyrexian-controlled territory.

trait.name: Allied Magic.
entries: Whenever Raff casts a spell, a friendly caster within 30 ft. of you may choose to use its reaction to empower Raff's magic, spending a spell slot to either double the range of Raff's spell or increase its damage dice by two.

trait.name: Arcana Savant
entries: After touching a creature, Raff may recover one of their 3rd level or lower spell slots twice per long rest.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raff casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

action.name: Spyglass Bash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Uldrani Scar (Skirmisher) either makes three Dagger attacks or one Render them Null attack.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Render them Null
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage and the target must pass a Constitution Saving Throw ( {@dc 15} ) or have the magic in their body disrupted, making it so the target may not cast or benefit from any spells or magic items for one turn.
Any spell effects resume afterward, but this counts as time lost for any timed spell.
{@i To protect the home we love, we suffer. To expand our reach to the grand sea, we recover. We suffer, to a new age usher.}
entries.by: An old Uldrani battle hymn, sung by new bloods.

entries: Like all of Uldrans military forces, the Scars are devoted to a fault, ready to die for their goals, so much so they earn their name from their horribly scarred bodies, not from experimentation nor harsh punishments, but from their vicious battle-style, fueling their own rage with sheer pain, to a point of having scientists develop a serum to destroy and restore their organs, all to reach the Sufferer's Battle Trance.

Besides guards, these are the main foot-soldiers from the Uldrani empire, being dispached in reasonably small numbers to efficiently and brutally dispose of any unwanted threat or anything that requires force, all having been trained to disrupt the flow of the very mana that flows inside all beings, even if for a second.

trait.name: To Fuel Order
entries: If the Uldrani Scar (Skirmisher) takes 20 or more damage in one turn, they enter an Sufferer's Battle Trance.
During this, their move speed is increased to 35 ft, their attacks have a {@hit 6} to hit and they deal one additional damage die, in addition to all of this their AC is reduced to 14.
This Trance lasts for 3 rounds.

trait.name: Mandragora Vial
entries: Once per combat, the Uldrani Scar (Skirmisher) may use an action to take a swig from a black and green brew attached to their mask, one that deals 20 poison damage when ingested, yet healing them for {@dice 3d8 + 4} afterward.
The Scar cannot be reduced beyond 1 hit point by this method.
If the Scar attempts to ingest more in the same combat, they will take double the damage and will not heal, as they overdose on the potent medicine.

trait.name: Death Saving Throws.
entries: Rona rolls death saving throws whenever she falls {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Grave Magic.
entries: When Rona cast a spell that deals damage, she can change the spell's damage type to necrotic.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Painful Spells
entries: Whenever Rona casts a spell, roll a {@dice d20}. If the result is 11 or higher, she deals an extra dice of spell damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rona is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rona attacks twice with her sickle.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and the target has disadvantage on all saving throws until Rona's next turn..

Rona is a young woman with platinum-brown skin and dark umber curls who wears the cloak of the Tolarian Academy with an added circular star chart motif bisected by a line to make the symbol of New Phyrexia. She has a mechanical eye featuring a miniaturized ray cannon. She carries a glaive and has other Phyrexianized enhancements, including a device in her leg.

Rona has trained in the Tolarian tradition of magical study, and as a member of the Society of Mishra, she has strayed from those traditions in her pursuit of forbidden Phyrexian lore. She has used her biomechanical magic to replace one eye and make a few other modifications to her body in pursuit of improving and transcending her merely human form. In her studies, she draws inspiration from Gix, an ancient Thran rebel who became a Phyrexian Demon, "compleated" and perfected by augmenting his body with metal.

trait.name: Menacing Foe
entries: If less than two hostile creatures are within 5 ft. of Rulik Mons, any melee attack against Rulik Mons has disadvantage and a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

trait.name: Unnatural Insight
entries: Rulik Mons has a +2 bonus to ability checks made to discover if a creature is lying to her.

trait.name: Mountain Dweller
entries: Rulik Mons takes no penalty to her movement speed when walking on difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rulik Mons makes two shortsword attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 (@damage {@dice 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 (@damage {@dice 3d6}) poison damage.

Rulik Mons, a descendent of Pashalik Mons, was not known to many of Dominaria's great leaders before Sheoldred's invasion. When Rulik Mons emerged from the Rundvelt mountains with a warband made up of nine different goblin tribes, all pledged to the banner of The Coalition, they were surprised to say the least - but certainly grateful.
Originally from the Voda Sea, Tatyova left her home to study to become a druid in Yavimaya. This allowed her to become more attuned to the magic of forests.

Tatyova is a trained druid attuned to both the tides and the coastal forests of Dominaria. After completing her training with the elves of Yavimaya, she returned to her home in the undersea empire of Vodalia. She has been instrumental in tempering Emperor Mihail II's more martial impulses and strives to build a merfolk society that can serve as defenders of the natural world.

trait.name: Ocean's Tide
entries: Tatyova can perform a 10-minute ritual to tap into the essence of the oceans around her for 1 mile, feeling any impurities or issues with the fauna or flora.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

Tori was born with a degenerative disease, rare but not unheard of to royalty of the D'Avenant line. By the time she was a teenager, she had lost the use of her legs entirely. While this somewhat complicated her training as a cavalry officer, it hardly stopped her. Now, with a specially trained warhorse and a custom saddle, Tori rides into battle at the head of the Avenant Fury Riders. She is known especially for her fearlessness in battle, never flinching from a line of enemy spears.

trait.name: Alert
entries: Tori D'Avenant can't be surprised while she is conscious.

trait.name: Trampling Strikes
entries: Whenever Tori D'Avenant critically hits, her damage dice are tripled instead of doubled.

trait.name: Aura of Courage
entries: Friendly creatures within 10 ft. of Tori D'Avenant attack with advantage, and receive a +1 bonus to both attack and damage rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tori D'Avenant makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage. If the creature is a fiend, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of Tori D'Avenant's next turn.

reaction.name: Unyielding
entries: When Tori D'Avenant is subjected to an effect that would move her, knock her {@condition prone}, or both, she can use her reaction to be neither moved nor knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery
entries: Once per day, Vohar can choose two expended spell slots to recover.

trait.name: Arcane Drain
entries: Once per day, when Vohar deals damage with a spell attack, he may choose to deal an extra die of damage, and recover the damage dealt in hit points.

action.name: Wires
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vohar is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, +3 to hit with spell attacks). Vohar has the following wizard spells prepared:

entries: {@b Variant: Familiars} Any spellcaster that can cast the find familiar spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a crawling claw, imp, pseudodragon, or quasit. In a Phyrexian's case, they can instead cast the Phyrexian Espionage spell, and use its familiar.

A would-be usurper of Vodalia, Vohar sought to seize control of the empire from Mihail II and lead the merfolk in a campaign of bloodshed and glory against the surface world. When his traitorous plot was discovered, Vohar was banished to the abyssal layer of Dominaria's oceans. In exile, he encountered an ancient Phyrexian on the sea floor awoken by Sheoldred's incursion. Compleated, Vohar still seeks the destruction of Mihail for the glory of New Phyrexia.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: Uurg, Son of Turg can hold its breath for 15 minutes

trait.name: Macabre Power
entries: Uurg has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws if there are at least 10 corpses in a 90 feet range next to him.

trait.name: Rotten Lord
entries: After Uurg makes vegetation wither, his AC increases in +2 until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Uurg makes two Fist attacks and uses Defile (if available).

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Defile {@recharge}
entries: Ordinary vegetation within 10 feet of Uurg withers and dies. In addition, each creature within 10 feet of Uurg must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Uurg regains 5 ({@dice 1d10}) hit points for each creature that fails the saving throw.

When Turg, the mighty frog beast bonded to the merfolk ambassador to The Cabal, perished, he left behind a clutch of eggs. While the Cabal intended to use these to create more hulking pit fighters, one of the tadpoles escaped their control. Now Uurg, a specimen as mighty as Turg himself, freely roams the lands of Otaria, eating whomever he pleases

trait.name: Brave
entries: Zar Ojanen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: Zar Ojanen may choose to forgo one of her attacks. If she does so, one friendly creature within 30 feet of her has advantage on their next attack, and deals one extra damage dice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zar Ojanen makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Zar Ojanen adds 3 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Zar Ojanen must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
{@i “I carry my home in my heart.” }
Zar Ojanen is am Efravan leonin warrior with a muscular build from Dominaria. She is the sister of Pallar.

Efrava, once a verdant oasis amid the Jamuraan desert, is no more, lost to a nameless calamity of the past. The leonin that once inhabited this land are far from extinct, though. While some have scattered to the far corners of Dominaria, Zar Ojanen, a descendent of the fearsome mercenary Jedit Ojanen, now leads a caravan of Efravans as they travel through Jamuraa. Zar's heart is devoted to guiding and protecting her people, and she is as capable a warrior as her ancestor, more than willing to cross blades with any who threaten her caravan.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The Soultender has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Pluck Lifestrings
entries: The Soultender can remove the soul from within an {@condition unconscious} body, and carry it in one of its many arms. To free the soul, the Soultender must either be killed, or reasoned with.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk MW} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Sap Life
entries: {@atk RW} {@hit +4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) necrotic damage.

Eerie Soultenders are the guardians of the passage between this life and the next. They guide souls where they must be taken, as dictated by the actions in their past life. However, Soultenders are rational beings, and may be persuaded or bargained with. There have been stories of both heroes that convinced them to return their souls to their bodies, and villains that made Soultenders take a few souls earlier than they should, and make sure they weren't able to escape.

They can sap the life from creatures with necrotic spells, etched into symbols carved in the palm of their many hands, but rarely will these creatures attack without a very good reason, or without being controlled to. They avoid disrupting the balance of life and death.
If you ever find yourself traveling alone at night, do not take the hand that offers help from the darkness. It might be a Soultender looking to take you home.

trait.name: Raise Shields
entries: Any creature within 5 feet of the bulwark gains +1 AC.

trait.name: Elemental Absorption
entries: Whenever the bulwark or a friendly creature within 5 feet of it is targeted by an attack that deals elemental damage, the bulwark may use its reaction to try to absorb some of it. It rolls {@dice 1d6 + 3}, and subtracts the amount rolled from the total damage. After this, the bulwark is powered up, and may add the damage absorbed to the damage of their next attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bulwark makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Any experienced Artificer is welcome to join the war for Dominaria and unite with their peers. A walking bulwark takes 500 gold pieces to create, and a whole week to craft, but they have been able to bolster our allies unlike any other. Surprisingly, they're some of the easiest constructs to create for the conflict.
They don't have a conscience of their own, instead, they ever wander while they're activated, looking for friendly souls to shelter from the fire and ashes of combat.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
{@i “Unit alpha-6 locking into position!” }

The Shield-Wall Sentinels were the first in a line of several constructs created to aid the Dominarian frontliners in battle. They were soon replaced by stronger models, but, sometimes, you could still find the older versions in the front lines, never once failing to follow their directives while trying to protect every soldier that came close.

Any Artificer that knows the basics of Warforged construction could be able to build one. They are also very cheap, since the steel utilized for the robot's creation is cheap and abundant, only the stronger alloy used for the shield costs a bit more. In total, you would need to spend an entire week if working alone, or an entire day, if working with a group of at least four artificers, and 100 gp for the cost of the items to build this, those being:

action.name: Empowering node.
entries: The Glimmering Sentinel may restore one charge of a magical item by expending part of its own energy, taking {@damage 1d8 + 1} damage when doing so, this damage cannot be reduced in any way.

action.name: Gather Data.
entries: The Glimmering Sentinel analyzes a target creature within 60 ft. It makes an investigation check that must pass a DC equal to 10 + the targets level/CR ( If CR below 1, they count as 1. )
On success, the Glimmering Sentinel has advantage on all attacks targeting the creature for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Life-Charged
entries: Any creature can spend their action to transfer one charge of a magic item ( That they are attuned to if the item must be attuned. ) towards the Glimmering Sentinel, restoring {@dice 1d8 + 1} of its health.

trait.name: Shared Intranet
entries: When a Glimmering Sentinel succesfully uses Gather Data against a creature, all other Glimmering Sentinels connected to the same intranet gain its benefits.

reaction.name: Target Removal Order
entries: The Glimmering Sentinel shoots any creature within range with a {@b Shock-shot.} whenever they attack a creature considered friendly to the Glimmering Sentinel, including itself. This reaction may also be taken when a creature that has attacked one of the Sentinel's allies before moves.
{@b Shock-shot} {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Emergency Removal Order.
entries: The Glimmering Sentinel shoots target creature within range with an {@b Overloaded-Shot} whenever they deal a fourth or more of another creatures total health points in damage with a single attack.

{@b Overloaded-shot} {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) lightning damage, the Glimmering Sentinel takes {@damage 1d8 + 1} damage as they damage their inner circuits..
{@b Creating Your Own}
A journeyman artificer ( 5th level ) or otherwise capable person ( As defined by the DM ) may re-create their own Sentinel that follows their orders, provided they have the proper blueprints.

This process takes one week of work and a total of 350 GP of materials, consisting of 150 GP of assorted materials, scrap metal and other metals for its casing, 100 GP of rare gems for arcane tuning, particularly amethysts, and 100 GP of Anima Batteries, this cost is reduced if the craftsman has any of the materials in hand.

To finish the process the craftsman must pass a DC 26 artisan's tools check, which is reduced by 6 if the craftsman has proficiency in either smith's tools or jeweler's tools, and by a further 4 if you have experience ( Have attuned to before or cast the identify spell on ) with any Drakken-made magic item, including a Glimmering Sentinel.
{@b Creature Drops}
The Glimmering Sentinel, when defeated, may still have its weapons functional.

This weapon is a Glimmering Turret, which functions as a (20/60) range improvised weapon which uses charges as ammunition. You may spend one charge to perform a normal shot, which deals 2d4 lightning damage, or spend three charges to overload the weapon and perform an overloaded shot, dealing 3d8 lightning damage.

It can hold a maximum of 20 charges, defined by a 5+d10 when first inspecting the item. It can be fully recharged with the use of a {@i Anima Battery}. When below 5 charges, it has a risk of ceasing function, every time it is fired you must roll a d20, if the result is 5 or less, the weapon breaks.

An artificer or otherwise capable person ( As defined by the DM ) may properly retrofit this weapon into a Glimmering Pistol, which counts as a proper martial ranged weapon, making it so it doesn't break when low on charges and its overloaded shot costs only 2 charges. They may do this with no additional costs during a period of two uninterrupted long rests.

trait.name: Blood Cravings
entries: The wharf rat has advantage on perception checks against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wharf rat has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Siege Rat
entries: The wharf mama deals double damage to objects and structures, additionally, it may gobble up the remains of these to mix into its Water Gun, resulting in enabling a Rubble Shot attack..

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 bludgeoning damage and the target falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Water Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 / 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rubble Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 / 60 ft., one target. {@h} 21 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus the target must make a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

An uncommon, but still quite unpleasant sight to see on the sea, much less aboard. These enlarged, engorged Wharf Rats have grown to live more than a few years, long enough to get their own runts and to have eaten about two to three entire ships! In fact, they ate so much they seem to be able to mix the damn remains with the water they shoot out, everyone has to watch out for the cannonrat, now.
Their tails are still delicious, if not a bit juicier, and yes, even if they're male they are called Mama's, maybe thats why they're so angry all the time?

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Klahaman may do up to three attacks in one turn, either three Greaclub attacks or two Greatclub attacks and either one Snagpoon or Oxypoon attack.
He may do a Fisherpoon action instead of one of these attacks..

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Snagpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the Klahaman or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the Klahaman.

action.name: Oxypoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. It must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become winded, having their AC reduced by one and their movement speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of Klahaman's next turn.

action.name: Fisherpoon (3-4)
entries: The Klahaman goats the tip of his 'Poon with his Oxymuccus and then shoots it into the water, reeling up a random fish. The fish depends on the result of the following table:
1-20 - Giant Anglerfish
21-50 - Pirana Swarm
51-70 - Razor Wormling Swarm
71-90 - Hunter Shark
91-100 - Razor Reef
Fish caught this way are friendly to him.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Klahaman can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slinkby
entries: The klahaman doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it walks out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Oxigenated Banana
entries: The Klahaman has been imbued with Oxygen powers by consuming one of Yokozuna's Magic Fruits. It allows him to coat his weapons with a muccus that gives any creature the ability to breathe oxygen.

bonus.name: Oxy Moron's Puntpoon
entries: Using the back of one of his Snagpoons, he may punt one of his Oxywakened fish for up to 60 ft where he can see. If one of the Oxyawakened fish lands 5 ft close to a creature, they may perform an opportunity attack against it.

spell.name: Scout the Wilderness
entries: Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature's location, as long as that creature is within 1,000 feet of you. If the crearure is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.
The spell can also locate a species of creature in its range of effect. The user will be aware of how many of them are there around them, but not where exactly they are located.
This spell can't locate creatures if any thickness of lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between you and the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range is increased by 500 feet.

spell.name: Sculpt Ice
entries: You choose an empty space or an area of ice that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
Create a sculpture or a block of thin ice within a 5-foot cube. It will not melt because of any non-magical means, such as hot climate or fire, yet it will melt automatically after an hour.
You can shape up to 5-feet of ice simultaneously as you want. These changes occur slowly as you concentrate on shaping the ice.
You change the ice's color or opacity. This starts from a point you're touching and slowly reaches out to the rest of the surface. This lasts for up to an hour.
You can melt or sublime the ice in a 5-foot cube, if sublimed, the gas produced is not enough to obscure an area.

spell.name: Exhale Gas
entries: You exhale ( or create ) a cloud of either smoke, fog or dust that can cover up to a 10-foot radius that lightly obscure the area.
The fog or smoke shapes itself to fill in corners, You can manipulate the gas you created in one of the following ways:
Manipulate the gas to move or convey simple shapes and forms..
You can change the smell or color of the gas you create.
You can manipulate the gas you create to fly towards one creature's eyes. They must make a constitution saving throw or be blinded until your next turn.

spell.name: Jaya's Firenado

entries: {@i For all their supposed advances, the Phyrexians still aren’t fireproof.}

You create a vortex of fire that continuously spins around the area it was summoned, trying to pull in anyone to their demise. Any creature that is on the firenado's epicenter must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. Any creature within 30 feet of the firenado must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

Any creature within 60 feet of the firenado must make a Dexterity saving throw at the end of their turn. On a failed save, they are pulled 30 feet closer to the firenado. As a bonus action, you may move the firenado up to 10 feet.

Whenever a creature is pulled to the epicenter of the firenado, if it cannot share the space with its previous occupant, the larger one will remain there. If both creatures have the same size, the stronger one will remain there. If both have the same strength, the creature that was pulled will push away the creature that was there before. Any creature that leaves the epicenter of the firenado takes 2d6 fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range is increased by 500 feet.

components.m: the yet unkindled feather of a Phoenix

spell.name: Smash to Dust
entries: Choose an object or structure within range of the spell. You deal {@damage 4d8} damage to it, and if that is enough to destroy it, the object or structure immediately crumbles down. If the object or structure is Large or bigger, anyone within 10 ft. of it must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 2d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a succesful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Calamity
entries: You may create sensorial effects, they are innofensive, even if sinister or corruptive, such as:

items: Make ( non-sentient, non-magical ) vegetation wither away.
Make it so an object cause goosebumps when held for more than 1 minute.
Cause someone to feel observed for up to an hour.
Create small ( 5-feet ) luminous spots in darkness.
Crack mirrors and other bad omens.
Cause wind or animals to sound eerie and creepy.
Make any non-living and non-magical piece of organic matter rot, dust or cold.
Manipulate shadows in a 5-foot square into vague shapes.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Goodbye
entries: When casting this spell, you can choose any number of magic items, non-magical items and creatures in its area and attempt to send them into another plane of existence. Items that aren't being carried fail the saving throw immediately. Creatures that hold the items that are being banished and targeted creatures must make a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

If the targets are native to the plane of existence where you are, you banish the targets to an inoffensive demiplane. While they are there, the targets become {@condition incapacitated}. The targets remain there until the spells duration is over, then they will reappear on the space they were banished in or in the closest unoccupied space in case the original is occupied.

If the targets are native to a plane of existence different from that of where you are, the targets are banished with a soft snap, returning to their plane of origin. If the spell ends before ten minutes, the targets reappear on the space they were banished in or in the closest unoccupied space in case the original is occupied. If not, they do not return.

m.text: A dandelion and a gem that is worth 1000 GP, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Brilliant Restoration

entries: {@i We have done our best to heal this land together, yet now i must trust its future to my sister. She shall carry our dreams onward, until the sunrise.}

You restore any and all destroyed structure within a 2000 ft. ( 600 m. ) radius starting from where the spell was cast. Magical items that lost their properties have them restored. Very rare ( Or lower ) cursed items are purified. Temples and desecrated places are purified.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When this spell is cast using a spell slot of 7°th level its range increases to 2000 feet ( 600 m. ). The range increases to 3280 feet ( 1.000 m. ) at 8°th level, and to 6560 feet ( 2.000 m. ) at 9°th level.

m.text: A reptile's shed scale clad in jewellery that costs at minimum 500 GP, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Born to Drive
entries: You summon a carriage with spectral animals, the appearance of both are up to your choice. Name a place where you or someone present in the vehicle knows; The carriage will take the fastest and safest way to that place. If you do not know where the place is, but have a vague idea, the carriage will take the route that makes the most sense to you or to another person in the vehicle to arrive there.
If no one knows where the place is, nor has a vague idea, the vehicle will not move.

m.text: A part of a carriage or a toy vehicle that is worth at least 5 GP, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5°th level spell slot or higher, its duration increases by one week.

spell.name: Nero's Extinguished Wick
entries: You coat your fingers with ash and snap them while aiming at the target of the spell, which may be a creature or an object. A creature targeted by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d12} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a succesful one. If that kills it, the ashes are blown to another creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of the last creature. It must also make a Constitution saving throw, suffering {@damage 4d10} damage. If it dies, the cycle continues

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each spell slot level above 3rd.

components.m: Ashes from a burnt candle.

spell.name: Nero's Vision of Death
entries: Choose a number of targets within range equal to your Intelligence modifier multiplied by two. (minimum of 2). The targets must make a Wisdom saving throw, receiving visions of the things they most hate or fear while in a fight-or-flight state if they fail. At the end of each of your turns, you must make a concentration check (DC 16) for the spell's effects to remain active.

Targets Frightened by this spell react in one of two ways, as chosen by the caster from the options below. In addition to this effect, they also take {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage on the start of each of their turns.

entries.name: Fight
entries: The adrenaline pumping into the targets' veins fuels them to fight the things haunting them. The targets makes an attack roll against any allied creature within their reach, visualizing them as the antagonists of their fears and visions. They are unaffected by the disadvantage The Frightened condition imposes to make these attacks.

entries.name: Flight
entries: The targets use their action to Dash as far away from you and your allied creatures as possible. Since their minds are clouded, they could run into situations that would normally be life threatening as long as they fail an Insight check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Sigil of Griffin’s Ethereal Hop

entries: {@i A simple one, hm? Fine, fine, let me tell you about the Griffin’s sigil, you etch it like this, yes… Now, just a scratch on this and you will go flying like the creature itself! The best part? This little etching is mighty enough to briefly tear through the Ethereal, and what's more, try giving a good whack after a dash, the impulsive arcana in it will pack an even bigger punch!}
entries.by: Silas Greymoor, Wardscribing teacher of the South-Warden’s Magical Academy

entries: You etch a sigil resembling a griffin’s feather into your arcane focus and infuse it with a griffin's essence and your own arcane energy. You may use a free action on your turn to activate the sigil, when you do so the arcane energy in the sigil bursts out and envelops you, sending you briefly to the Ethereal plane, where the griffins essence empowers you to move up to 20 feet in any direction you want, you may pass through another creature without provoking opportunity attacks but you can’t phase through walls. If you move 20 feet using this spell, your next melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage. After using it once, the Sigil becomes inert.

components.m: A Griffins feather.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, up to 6th level, the spell's movement range increases by 20 feet and the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d8} per spell slot level above 1st for each 20 feet traveled.

spell.name: Urborg Repossession
entries: You touch a corpse. By infusing it with your arcane energy, you bloat its shape so that it becomes unrecognizable to anyone attempting to discern its identity for the duration of the spell. A Dispel Magic spell or higher is able to undo it, and anyone able to discern someone's spiritual energy, aura, or soul, would be able to see through it.

components.m: Ashes from an unknown source

spell.name: Blood-Soaked Missile

entries: {@i From the life of study we're devoted to, to what must be taken from the enemy and to the spells we cast every day, life itself is the sole cost.}
You draw a line with two fingers from your outstretched arm, from the wrist to the elbow, focusing mana and blood to form a magical string and a bloody arrow.

The arrow hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. The arrow deals {@dice 4d12} force damage to its target, and you take a third of the damage dealt, rounded down, as you use your own blood to fuel this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Repel Magic

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within reach casts a spell.

entries: {@i A beautiful thing it is, to turn harmful sorceries back to its caster, in a way to ward the life of others. Destroy your enemies, those who threaten the creation of Amarantia's hug, for they themselves deserve not her embrace anymore.}
entries.by: Golden Finger Rogier, Order of Amarantia

entries: Incantation learned by the Golden Fingers of Amarantia, developed after the appearance of the Tear.

You dispel a spell being cast by a creature, absorbing its energy and releasing it in succession at any direction that you choose. If the creature is casting a spell of 5th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. Right after that, you can make a ranged spell attack against any creature you can see within range. This attack deals {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.
If it is casting a spell of 6th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level. On a success, the same effects as before take place.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used, allowing you to make an attack right after.

spell.name: Silver Scrutiny
entries: Karn’s creation allowed him to monitor events across Dominaria — and everything he saw worried him.

You may create up to 5 magical looking glasses which show you known locations in the world or places you already visited of your choice in real time, acting like floating cameras for you. You may choose where in the locations the cameras are placed if you have already visited them, otherwise you may only choose outside or inside locations, and the spell will try to choose the best location to observe as much of the area as possible.
For each of these, you may also cast the Scrying spell to observe a creature instead.

m.text: a focus worth at least 3,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water

entries: Dominaria United Brews #70

spell.name: Briars of Punishment

entries: {@i As Trina kneeled in the blood-soaked battlefield, covered in the red liquid from friend and foe alike, she was granted a vision by the Warrior. In a puddle of blood in front of her sprouted a small red vine, covered in thorns, reminding her that even among death, life shall always prevail.}
Incantation conceived by St. Trina, the Sole Survivor, in the Battle of the Crossroads, after receiving a vision by Salasosia, the Goddess of War.

You hold the branch tightly, piercing your hand and dripping blood on the ground, which quickly moves towards a point you can see within range. From that point sprouts a series of bloody briars in a 10-foot-radius, causing {@damage 2d6} piercing damage to any creature in the area, and they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or start to {@condition bleed | CompendiumSecreto}
,- medium ({@damage 1d6} damage per level at the beginning of each of its turns, max. of 3 levels).

In addition, the area is difficult terrain, and for every 5 ft. of movement walked by a creature in the area, it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} of piercing damage. Every additional damage taken by a creature that is bleeding by this spell adds one level to the effect, according to its severity level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

components.m: a branch of vicious thorns from an old battlefield

spell.name: Light Disc
