entries.name: Covered in Rock
entries: You have natural armor equal to 13 + your constitution modifier.

entries.name: Miner Eyes
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thermal Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to either cold or fire damage, you must choose only one when creating your character.

entries.name: Stoneskin Intuition
entries: You gain proficiency when wielding light hammers, warhammers, warpicks and pickaxes.

entries.name: Rock Breaker
entries: You gain a tunneling speed of 10ft.

entries.name: Age
entries: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial. Primordial is a guttural language, filled with harsh syllables and hard consonants.

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Mingle with the Wind
entries: You can cast the {@spell levitate} spell once with this trait, requiring no material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

item.name: Fowl Amulet
entries: When you die wearing this item you are revived with full health points, without any disease nor penalty obtained before your death. The item is absorbed by your body giving you the Chicken Curse.

entries.name: Chicken Curse
entries: Blue feathers sprout from your skin and you must eat worms and vermin at each meal or you will suffer one point of exhaustion. You also have disadvantage in saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

item.name: Relic of Legends

entries: {@i If the worst parts of history can repeat themselves, it stands to reason that the best parts can as well..}

The Relic of Legends shines when in the presence of both luck and skill, which accompany great myths hand in hand. The next time you roll a natural 20, the Relic of Legends stores your expert maneuver, which involved both ability and chance. It glows very faintly with the magic inside it. You can only store one roll inside the Relic of Legends per use. To store another, the Relic of Legends must be empty.

Whenever you make an ability check, a saving throw or an attack roll, you may treat the roll as if it was a natural 20. After spending the natural 20, you may store another one, but you may not activate this ability again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Jodah's Codex

entries: {@i If you remember nothing else of our world’s history, remember this: Phyrexians can be defeated.}

You may transcribe any spell into this book, as long as you have a spellbook or scroll containing the spell. You may transcribe up to 3 spells. Once three spells have been transcribed this way, you may not transcribe any other spell.

Jodah's Codex has 3 charges, and it recovers {@dice 1d3-1} charges every morning. You may spend one of its charges to cast one of the spells transcribed into Jodah's Codex, as long as you have the level to cast it.
If a spell cast this way deals elemental damage, the damage is increased as if it had been cast one level higher.

item.name: Inscribed Tablet
entries: Any ancient language could be inscribed in this tablet, and its magical properties give you the necessary knowledge to read it.

At the discretion of the DM, any creature that reads the tablet learns to speak fluently a language of the DM's choice, which depends on the location where the tablet was found, or who it was obtained from.

item.name: Arrow of Event Horizons

entries: {@i The cosmos is unstable, expanding and constricting incessantly... We have learned to harness it. To allow us to bend and implode space itself with the pull of a string.}

This obsidian arrow has powerful runes etched at its blunt tip, making it so a void in space itself form when knocked into a bow, ready to slice all in its way. When shot, the arrows body is thrown into the void, exploding it fowards in a great slice.

You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. After hitting a creature, all other creatures around a 20ft sphere of it must make a DC 20 strenght (Athletics) saving throw or be pulled as close as they can be towards the initial target. The initial target also takes 2d6 additional force damage on a hit.

item.name: Petrification Rune
entries: This rune's engraving comes as a circle with an horizontal slit in it, dust and small stones collecting around where its etched.

A weapon with this rune etched in it can partially petrify a hit creature once per turn. On a hit, the creature must make a DC 16 ( Or your spellcasting DC modifier, whichever is higher ) Constitution modifier, or become partially petrified. The player may choose or roll a d4 to see what limb gets petrified, with even results hitting a leg and odds hitting an arm.
If a leg is hit, the target has its walking speed halved and has disadvantage on dexterity saving throws, failing automatically if both are petrified.
If an arm is hit, its hand is considered occupied and any rolls involving this arm have disadvantage.
Wings and other appendages may also be targeted, receiving the same conditions as appropriate, such as a wing having the same as a leg hit, or a tail having the same as an arm hit.
This rune can be etched into any melee or ranged weapon, including thrown weapons.

entries.name: Arcanist's Cookbook Issue #1940 Snippet
entries: Materials : Great Frilled Cockatrice's Beard [1x]
Any skilled blacksmith able to work magic items may forge this item, given the materials and 500GP.
Artificers, Wizards and Druids may create this item without the use of a formula for 250GP, a DC14 tool check and 3 days work.

item.name: Solar Armor

entries.name: Dropped by:
entries: Disciple of Saint Heuwlen
The Divine... They equipped their remnants well... Shameful. Shameful we... as a race... Have not yet surpassed their craft. Pitiful. My people... Pitiful.
While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. In addition, you become resistant to fire damage; if you're already resistant to fire damage, you instead become immune to it.

With this armor, your presence becomes either comfortable or unbearable, like a spring afternoon or a summer haze. When a creature starts their turn within 30 feet of you, you can force that creature to make a Constitution saving throw, where the DC is 10 + CON + proficiency. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 4d6} fire damage and becomes {@condition blind } until the end of their next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and you regain all expended uses upon the dawn of a new day.

entries.name: Blessing
entries: If a player dons this armor while being a faithful of Glarius, her warm embrace will empower and transform them. If they participated in the killing of the disciple, they will feel an uncomfortable guilt regarding their actions. Slowly, a spark within their heart will ignite, and they will have a dream where they find themselves in the Cradle of Embers, with an Avatar of Glarius, usually Saint Heulwen, standing in front of them with might, but care. The player will gain the choice to either burn like the sun, and become a new disciple; or to shine like a torch to guide all lost Pilgrims of Glarius.

If the player chooses to burn like the sun, their sheet becomes that of a {@creature Disciple of Saint Heulwen|CS}, except they will still be able to roll death saving throws. However, their ideals and personality will be shaped likewise, and their desire to roam the land of Alacritas alone while safekeeping their flame will increase with each passing day, usually culminating when their current quest is finally completed.
If the player decides to become a torch, they will gain access to the following spells; they can choose whether their casting ability is INT, WIS or CHA:

entries.name: At Will:
entries: {@spell continual flame}, {@spell green-flame blade|TCE}, {@spell remove curse}, {@spell sacred flame}, {@spell searing smite}

entries.name: 3/day each:
entries: {@spell investiture of flame|XGE}, {@spell sickening radiance|XGE}, {@spell summon celestial|TCE}

entries.name: 1/day each:
entries: {@spell maddening darkness|XGE}, {@spell power word kill}, {@spell temple of the gods|XGE}

entries.name: Curse
entries: A player that dons this armor without paying their due respects to or being a follower of Glarius will be cursed by the eternal darkness brought upon by her absence. The player will become permanently {@condition blind}, even if they doff the armor, and they become vulnerable to fire damage. Additionally, they will feel a coldness abrading their heart frequently, with nothing short of a higher deity of fire's blessing to, at least temporarily, ease the maddening lack of warmth within.

entries.name: Incandescent
entries: The player may spend an action to fuse the Spark of the Everlasting Star with this Solar Armor. Upon doing so, they become immune to fire damage, the armor gives a +3 bonus to AC, and the area damage they are able to deal with it becomes {@dice 6d6}.

Whenever they {@action Dash} as a bonus action, they'll leave behind a trail of fire that lasts until the start of their next turn. Any creature that starts its turn or walks through the trail must make a dexterity saving throw with DC 10 + CON + proficiency or take 2d6 fire damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, they are able to spend an action to conjure a pair of phoenix-bound wings, granting them a flying speed equal to their walking speed. With a bonus action, they may tear one of their wings off, diminishing their walking speed in half, but recovering{@dice 8d6} hit points. They are also able to hand one of the wings to any creature of their choice within 10 ft. of them, healing them instead. If they consume both wings, they lose their flying speed.
Once they summon their phoenix-bound wings, they will not be able to do so again until they take a Long Rest.
The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

item.name: Bracelet of Permanence
entries: {@note [ Price : 70000 GP ]}
{@i A bracelet forged in the center of the order's elemental plane. The bracelet's innate energy is so potent that its destruction could trigger natural disasters across the world.
{@i May mountains rise and stand. May the wind that is about to fall blow. May my power never cease.}
A bracelet made of extremely resistant chrome-plated metal.
Once a week you can cast a spell or choose a spell that is already in effect (duration longer than instantaneous). This spell becomes permanent.
If you target a creature, it must make a DC 20 charisma check, on a success, the spell does not become permanent, and you do not expend your use.

If you try to make another spell permanent before the week's deadline, the bracelet will break and cause natural disasters on the plane you reside. The intensity and locations affected will be in accordance with the dm judgement.

item.name: Smoke Jumpers
entries: {@note [ Price : 250 GP | Artificer Price : 125 GP ]}
{@i IAMTHESQUIDYOUKNOWWHATIMEAN}

The Smoke Jumper boots are a pair of steel-soled and leather bound boots with a mechanism to generate intense amounts of steam on their heels, also storing it and spreading said heat through its soles.

items: You take 1 fire damage on the start of their turn.
You have a 5 additional walking speed.

You may use their bonus action to stomp their heels, unleashing the vapour and smoke stored within the boots, flying in a 15-ft high and 15-ft far line in a direction of your choice without provoking opportunity attacks, in addition, the smoke left behind covers a 10-ft radius of the space you were before you jumped, obscuring the vision of any creature within, and remains for 1d4 rounds, or until a strong gust blows it away.
Changing the damage of unarmed attacks to fire damage.

Instead of jumping away when the Smoke Jumpers are charged, a monk may deploy its charge when attacking as a powerful kick for the cost of 1 ki point. This kick obscures a radius of 10-ft around the monk, the sheer heat deals an extra 1d10 fire damage to the target creature, and half to the monk. In addition to that, the volume of the smoke forces the target to make a strength saving throw against the monk's Ki save DC or be pushed away 10-ft.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Any artificer with proficiency in Smith's tools, Leather worker's tools or Cobbler's tools may craft this item with the material cost of 125 GP, or a pair of leather boots, a few scraps of steel ( or any other metal ) and a heat-infused material, such as Red Dragon's scales, the glans of a Salamander or a Flammibal's essence.
To perform this, the crafter must pass a base DC 14 tool check ( With their tools of trade ) with he crafting process takes 2 hours.
Any spell caster with proficiency may attempt to craft this item with a +2 modifier to its base DC.
If Cobbler's Tools are used for the creation of Smoke Jumpers, the base DC of this item's creation has a -4 modifier to its base DC.

item.name: Jackalope's Chaotic Feet
entries: {@i A witch-crafted amulet thrown into human societies to create pure chaos and amusement to the old hags.}
Once per day, you can hold the amulet and say the magic words ''miser canis felix cattus'' while looking at a humanoid creature.

The amulet will then resound with mischievous laughter around you and you will somehow steal your target's luck for 2d12 hours or until the person performs some ritual, intentionally, to ward off bad luck (knock your fist on wood, go to a cleric, etc...), after that the last person the target talked to will have to roll the table to know what effect he will suffer for 2d12h. This cycle will continue until one of the people does not remove the jinx or a cleric uses lesser restoration on the cursed person, the person who accidentally suffers the curse will not benefit from the table's positive effects.

entries.caption: Ideal
rows: Roll again but take negative effect and give the target the positive.
The target lose 5 pieces of silver per hour (if  they do not have this value, it will suffer material losses until you reach the maximum value)
A vendor hands you your favorite food (1d6 temporary hit points) by the duration.
All the target's food  is ruined, falling to the ground, some insect landing on it, being rotten...
You feel inspired. Natural 20 on your next crafting or working check.
The target feel unspired. Natural 1 on all  they crafting or working checks by the duration.
The target feel sleepy and every time they close their eyes they wake up with a terrible nightmare.
Attractive people invite you to a party.
Random people on the street laugh, antagonize or give the target weird looks.
You find fancy clothes to your liking to sell for a pittance.
The target steps on mud, birds poop on you, your pants rip...
The target is accused of false crimes and is mistaken for a criminal.
Little inconvenient obstacles get in the target's way and annoy you all day.
You talk like nobody else, for a day you will have triple advantage on persuasion checks.
The target talks like a nobody, for a day you will have  slurred and dubious speech causing triple disadvantage on persuasion checks, and a -5 penalty.
Convenient little things help you all day.
Little inconvenient obstacles get in the target's way and annoy the target all day.
The dm choose a cr 1/8 or greater creature of MM to be your loyal companion.
Target's pet dies and other animals are hostile.

entries: (The dm can choose different effects for subsequent targets.)

item.name: A Shred of Yourself
entries: {@note [ Price : 0 GP ]}
{@i People keep thinking on and on about their feelings but... What about their feelings' feelings?}

{@i This is a small piece of you who couldn't handle it anymore, the monotony of life, the sense of never accomplishing, the deep longing. It is a spark unto itself, breathing life into the reality you share, unashamed.}

The Shred as it escapes has the form of a small shred of paper, its color being often times your favorite. As it hangs freely from you, it takes the shape that best represents a cherished memory, a paranoid thought or another aspect of you, and from that visage, affects the world around its immediate viccinity, as if shaping reality itself. Once every six hours, the Shred may cause any effects from the Wish spell, with the caveat of covering only a 300-ft radius around it. The effects of the spell are defined by the DM, and often reflect the shred itself.

entries.name: Severance and Reunion
entries: To attune to the Shred of Yourself, there is only one way. Not through magic rituals or material offerings, one must instead make peace with one way or another, be it by promising to fulfill a lost desire and having a true desire to go through it, working through your own mistakes or other means. As the Shred is pacified, it turns back to paper, which will be reabsorved when touched. It does not consume an attunement slot.

Once reunited and attuned, you may recall to this experience with a bonus action, gaining an extra d4 to your next roll. You may do it once per long rest, provided you recollect on your experiences during that time in one form or another.

{@note Feywild, Dreamscapes, the Lands Out of Home, the name of all doesn't matter there, only the one, and as with name - imbued with power is the self. In the grandious Yellow City, Aldebaran, where masks don the people and ones will shapes the world around, a persons feelings become evermore important, almost mixing with  their very soul and body, and much like the muscle of a body may become atrophiated with enough time being neglected, a lingering desire or unfullfilled will may refuse to be with the self, within the body and with the soul, breaking free from oneself like a small shred of paper which bends and morphs into a tiny artifact of your essence, the good and the bad, with no more inibition, ready to experience its unabashed freedom.}

item.name: Theseus' Wayfinder
entries: {@note [ Price : 300 GP | Artificer Price : 150 GP ]}
{@i Try to get through the Market District, I dare you! Try to navigate this maze of tunnels without one of these! I swear, you'll only end up lost for days!}

Theseus' Wayfinder is a small compass, bejewelled and enchanted through a mapping ritual, connected to a specific space so all places inside may be found. By speaking its command word and the name of the place you're looking for, the compasses needle shall turn to point the best way to the desired location, albeit not always with the safest route.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: To create an Theseus' Wayfinder, one must be able to cast spells, be in possession of a detailed map of a settlement, maze or region, a compass and  rare gem worth at least 80 GP. The crafter must remove the compasses needle and socket the gem in its center, then procceeding to perform a ritual by burning and thus binding the map's information into the gem, and then re-attaching the needle atop the gem. To perform this, the crafter must pass a DC 14 arcana check, and spend at least 2 hours to finish the crafting proccess.
If the ritual fails, the map is destroyed, but all other materials are not.

item.name: Blast Hooker
entries: {@note  [ Market Price : 499 GP | Gunsmith : 250 GP ] [ Regular Harpoon : MP : 1 GP | Gunsmith : 2 SP ]}
{@i Mariner's choice, eh?. 'Ave this baby on deck, be it to follow suit or take a stalker out, it'll serve 'ya mighty well.}
Most ships from the Dirgehallow bay keep one of these aboard, a popular tool through and through, commonly being used to keep a ship following another with ease, or to cause some damage when needed.

entries.name: Mighty Catcher
entries: On a hit with the Blast Hooker, you may use a bonus action to reel in the harpoon. If the target is smaller than you, the target is pulled into 5-ft of you. If the target is of equal size, the target must make an Athletics check against the yourAthletics DC, on a failure, they are pulled into 5-ft of you.  If the target is larger than the you, you are pulled into a distance of your choice closer to the target, and you are considered tethered to the creature, which has its movement speed halved as you are pulled in its direction as you are moved as well.
If the target is a vehicle larger than yourself, you are tethered to it, but its speed is unchanged.

entries.name: Deadly D12
entries: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size.

entries.name: Kickback
entries: A kickback weapon is extra powerful and difficult to use due to its high recoil. A kickback weapon deals 1 additional damage with all attacks. Firing a kickback weapon gives a –2 penalty to the attack roll, but characters with Strength equal or greater to the value specified on the weapon ignore the penalty. Attaching a kickback weapon to a deployed bipod, tripod, or other stabilizer can lower or negate this penalty, as well as firing while prone.

item.name: Alchemist's Glove
entries: The alchemist's glove is made from an explosion-resistant leather that possibilitates its user to utilize bombs by literally punching a target ( Make a meelee attack using either your intelligence or strenght bonus ) instead of throwing them.
The glove can hold up to 3 bombs ( or reagent vials ) that are switched out through a rope mechanism that moves based on weight. It can also be used to punch for 1d4 bludgeoning damage.
Attacking without proficiency in this weapon will cause the bomb to damage you when it explodes.

item.name: Tattooist's Kit
entries: In order to create a tattoo, mundane or magical, one must have proficiency with Tattooist's Tools, which is a type of Artisan Tools. To ink a magical tattoo, one must have at least one level in a spellcasting class and have proficiency with these tools. In order to gain proficiency with these tools, you may either practice with them long enough or gain the proficiency from the certain Backgrounds and Races.

This kit comes in a sturdy briefcase of some description and contains a variety of various colored inks, needles, and medical supplies needed for sterilization. The kit may also include a sketchbook filled with original tattoo designs or magical templates that the artist may find on their journeys.

Tattooist's Tools are needed to create any tattoos, whether they have magical properties or not. Each set initially contains a variety of ink colors, but to make any magic tattoos certain ingredients may still be needed.

item.name: Vanquisher's Axe
entries: When a Keldon takes a trophy from an enemy, it’s usually something they can use to kill more enemies.
Whenever you kill something with this weapon, its blades gleam.

item.name: Phantom Glass (Fake)
entries: {@note [ Price : 5000 GP per pound. ] }
Obtained from an infusion of obsidian created by a dragon's fire or lightning and ectoplasm.
The True Phantom Glass  is obtained in the ethereal plane, but due to the difficulty of obtaining a portal there it is more expensive.
The weapon made of Phantom Glass (fake) can cut the first layer of material, propertie very usefull to create internal injuries.

item.name: Mimic Sword

entries: {@i Like warfare personified, it'll take the shape its wielder knows is needed... What a terrible tool I have created.”}

This intricately designed hilt of a sword sports a broken blade, its cracks and dents littered with carefuly etched enchantments. Its broken half is lukewarm to the touch, and you swear you can feel yourself grow envious of something near you whenever you touch it for too long...
When you attune to this item, you must select a command word for it to respond.

entries.name: Other's Wannabe
entries: The Mimic Sword binds shape, essence and soul. A creature attuned to it may in turn attune the Mimic Sword itself to another melee weapon within reach during a long rest. The Mimic Sword, while attuned, may have its command word uttered as a free action to release the form of the attuned weapon, until the command word is uttered by its attuned creature again, it retains the stats of the attuned weapon. The Mimic Sword may not attune to artifacts. The Mimic Sword may only be attuned to one other weapon, and its previous attunement is broken when attuning to a new weapon.

item.name: Ben's Enchanted Weave
entries: {@i Refinement is required even to sever human flesh.}
WBen's Enchanted Weave is a magical fabric created from the crest of a unicorn and threads woven from the scales of a silver dragon, imbuing it with a reactive essence to magic.
As a bonus action, you can infuse the fabric with your mana, causing it to assume the shape of an adamantine object of your choice.
Additionally, you can expend one of the 8 charges (recovers 1d8 charges at dawn) to activate the following abilities:

entries.name: Improvised Gauntlet
entries: As a reaction after an enemy declares an attack against you, you can wrap the cloth around your hand, transforming it into a protective gauntlet that adds 1 AC to your armor class.

entries.name: Dancer's Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can manipulate the fabric, fashioning it into a weapon of your choice.
You can create a {@item spear | PHB}, {@item rapier | PHB}, {@item shortsword | PHB}, {@item longsword | PHB}, {@item scimitar | PHB}, or {@item dagger | PHB}.

All of these weapons possess the Versatile and Light properties and are considered magical. They retain their form for 1d4 minutes or until dismissed. You can make an attack with the weapon as soon as it is formed, gaining advantage on the attack roll.
When you create the gauntlet or weapon, you can choose to secure it tightly around your hands, requiring it to be severed to be removed.

item.name: Bokken
entries: A training sword made of regular bamboo or wood. Bokken were light weapons designed to lessen the damage caused by fighting with real swords and were used for the training of samurai warriors in Sakyô.

item.name: Kanabô
entries: The Kanabo is a two-handed war club weapon that is either spiked or studded. Its general shape is of a long rectangle coated in blunt spikes, it usually made of metal with a thick heavy end tapering towards a slender handle with a pommel.

item.name: Sakyô Throwing Needles
entries: These are easily-made small sharp spikes normally created in Sakyô. They are made light enough to be held between four fingers and easily thrown in sets of 3.

What these spikes lack in size and weight, they make up for in versatility. You may draw or stow up to three of these spikes on a single item interaction, and hold up to three of these spikes with a single hand. You may throw up to three of these weapons as an attack.
They can not be used to make Melee attacks, and you can not add your Dexterity modifier to their attack rolls.

item.name: Firegem Dart
entries: They are small, throwable darts made with a casing made of ( Sumi-Take )charcoal-bamboo, which has a circular compartment in its back and slopes down to a sharp point at its front. Within them is a tiny amount of dormant firegem dust towards its back, which is awakened by breaking a seal on top of it. They are held with just one finger through a curved handle that is usually covered in cloth

As a free action, you can break the seal on top of the dart and awaken the firegem dust, making it volatile. When it is thrown and impacts a surface, the awakened firegem dust explodes and every creature in a 10ft radius must  a DC ( 8+Your proficiency bonus+Your dexterity modifier) dexterity saving throw. Any target in that range takes 1d8 fire damage on a failed safe, or half of it on a success. After exploding the dart is lost.
If you otherwise do not break the seal, the dart is still recoverable.

item.name: Frostgem Dart
entries: They are medium throwable tube-like darts made out of enhanted ice which thins out to sharp pointy end. Instead of a handle, at its base it has a ring wrapped in cloth that you can wrap two fingers in and fling it at a target . Within the tube is a tiny amount of dormant Frostgem dust , which is awakened by breaking a seal on top of it.

As a free action, you can break the seal on top of the dart and awaken the frostgem dust, making it volatile. When it is hits a target, the awakened frostgem dust explodes around the target, forcing them to make a DC ( 8+Your proficiency bonus+Your dexterity modifier) constitution saving throw. If they fail they take an extra 1d8 Frost damage and as ice grows around targets joints, they get their movement speed reducted by 10ft, on a success, the target takes only half of the frost damage. The dart is broken after it hits a surface.
If you otherwise do not break the seal, the dart is still recoverable.

item.name: Hero's Heirloom

entries: {@i A blade is just a tool. Its power comes from the hand that wields it.}
This sword is gifted only to promised heroes, that will rise like legends to accomplish mythical tasks. It's said to glow next to those history will certainly remember.

This longsword grants its wielder a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with it. It glows as bright as a torch when attuned to its wielder, showing their capabilities and bright future as a hero. You can make it stop glowing on command as a bonus action.
If the sword is glowing, you deal an extra 1d6 radiant damage with your damage rolls.

item.name: Lithromic Mantle
entries: This usually greyish red, greyish green or greyish blue mantle has frilled flaps of fabric hanging all around it, all ending in rocky formations, its entire outside feeling dry and rough to the touch, a contrast to its remarkably
comfortable inside.  This mantle holds immense amounts of infused mana from a slain Frilled Cockatrice, being able to be used to fuel magic much like the monstrosity.
Whenever any effect would make you petrified, you can instead use your reaction to resist that effect.

Once per day you may use an action to unleash the inert mana inside the Lithromic mantle, every creature in a 15-ft radius centred at you must make a DC 16 ( Or your spell casting modifier, whichever is
higher. ) Constitution saving throw or be petrified for 1 minute.

You may use an action to curl up in your mantle, petrifying its frills to defend yourself. You gain the effects of the spell Stoneskin. You may use this ability an amount of times equal to your proficiency
modifier, rounded up. These uses are restored after a long rest.

You may use an action to fully petrify yourself, suffering from the normal effects of the condition, with the exception of being able to listen to your surroundings and look around with your eyes, unable to
move your head. While petrified in this way, you gain advantage to any checks regarding being acknowledged as a statue. You may use a bonus action to cease being petrified.

optionalfeature.name: Good Luck Offering
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your eldritch blast, you can reduce that creature's Strength score by ( 1d4 ) until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Joint Spell

entries: {@i Okay — you take the sixteen ragers and the hulk on the right. I’ll take the ten defilers and the plaguelord on the left. Ready?”}

When you cast a spell at a creature that hasn't been attacked yet this turn, if another creature has already been attacked by an ally within 60 feet of you, you may spend 3 sorcery points to increase the spell level by one instead of spending the higher spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Prayer of Binding
entries: {@i When a Phyrexian agent cannot be killed, they must be contained.}

As a bonus action, you attempt to bind a Large or smaller Phyrexian you can see within 30 feet of you, which must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the cursed creature is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute and can affect any Phyrexian regardless of size. The cursed Phyrexian can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success..

optionalfeature.name: Tribute to Urborg
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your eldritch blast, you can reduce that creature's Strength score by 1d4 until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Battle-Rage Blessingy

entries: {@i Since when is it cheating to give one side an unfair advantage?”}
Feeling the pains of battle, you may empower yourself or an ally with the necessary rage to finish the combat.

As a reaction whenever you or a creature within 30 ft. of you hits another creature with a melee attack, you may target the creature receiving the attack. The target must perform a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The target takes an added amount of damage based on the same amount of damage the attacking creature has received this round on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Destroy Evil
entries: Serra’s grace most often manifests as a healing touch, but it may also grant a merciful death.
Whenever you hit a Fiend with a weapon attack, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to it based on your weapon's damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Cut Down

entries: {@i There can be no mercy, no half measures. When facing Phyrexians, it’s kill swiftly or die.”}
Whenever you hit a Phyrexian with a weapon attack, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to it based on your weapon's damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Prophecy
entries: {@i Lord Windgrace, grant me wisdom.}
Once per week, you may reach out to the deity that has made a Pact with you in search of answers.

During meditation, you may spend 10 minutes reaching out to the being that has signed a Pact with you. You may ask a single yes or no answer, which the deity has no obligation to reply truthfully, nor will it always have the answer for your question, but it will respond to you as it sees fit. The stronger your bond towards it is, the more likely it is to receive a truthful answer.

optionalfeature.name: Extinguish the Light
entries: Channeling the dark energy of the spirits echoing in the world, you may magically extinguish any non-magical light sources within a 60 ft. range of you.

As they're extinguished, they suck the energy around them before being enclosed in a cloud of darkness. Any creature within 5 ft. of one of those light sources must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. If they fail, they take 1d6 necrotic damage, and are Frightened until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Call for Forbidden Knowledge

entries: {@i F-Fret not, friends! The stars beckon for truth, and they'll deliver, I know they will! Please, help us... The door! The door leads to an escape! B-but... Theres more beyond the door, more that the stars show... Far away, but coming closer, always coming closer- I- I can't go!}
entries.by: A follower of the constellations, stunned at overflowing information.

entries: Thrice per week, you may call upon your patron for occult knowledge upon a topic that you could not grasp for yourself, at the cost of your own sanity. Whenever you roll History, Nature, Arcana or Religion, you may choose to treat the result as a natural 20.  The knowledge gained comes from the perspective of your patron, who will answer to the best of their abilities, provided you are in their graces, they however, may get facts wrong or be unable to find reliable information. You must spend a spell slot to use this infusion. After the first time you use this ability, you must wait seven days to use it again, worsening afterward

For the first time this is done in the week, roll on the Short-Term Madness Table, and suffer the results for 1d10 minutes, besides losing your ability to heal two of your hit die during a short rest until the end of the week.
On a second use, you must roll on the Long-Term Madness Table, suffering the results for 1d10 hours. You may only heal up to half your hit die in a short rest, until the end of the week.

On a third use, you must roll on the Indefinite Madness Table and suffer the consequences for your pursuit of knowledge. This madness may only be relieved through a Greater Restoration spell or beyond.

optionalfeature.name: Bite Down

entries: {@i Yavimaya takes care of herself; the kavu are evidence of this. What does your Coalition offer that the forest cannot provide?}

As an action, you may spend one of your spell slots to cover your body with the ravenous vines of Yavimaya. Until your next short rest, the next time you would take damage, instead you take half as much damage, and the source of the damage will take half as much damage as well as long as it is a creature, being engulfed by the vines.

optionalfeature.name: Colossal Growth
entries: {@i The infused item can send a jolt to the target to bolster their physical size. The item has 4 charges. You can expend 1 charge of the item to shoot a target and increase }
its size by one size larger for 1 minute, receiving an extra +1 on their Constitution saving throws and damage rolls. By expending 4 charges, the target grows two sizes larger
for 1 minute, receiving an extra ( 1d4 ) for their Constitution saving throws and damage rolls. The item regains (1 d4 ) expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: In Thrall to the Pit
entries: You may create a robotic item of any shape or form that you desire, small enough to fit into someone's clothes or in the crevice of a structure. During the creation of the infusion, you will imprint in it the image of a target, a sentient creature you have met sometime in your life, and a one-word command you wish to give to this target. The infusion is usually inert, but will attempt to follow the target wherever they go as soon as it enters a 10 ft. radius of it. The infusion has a walking speed of 35 ft.

Upon being 10 ft. near its target, the infusion will start to whisper the command to it. This whisper can be heard not only by the target, but by any other creature next to it. They may attempt to find its source by rolling an Investigation ability check against your spell save DC. The infusion can be destroyed. It has 1 point of HP, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Once the target hears the whisper, it must roll a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it will be under the effect of a Command spell related to the one word you issued. If it succeeds, the target may roll an Investigation ability check to attempt to find the source of the whisper. The infusion repeats this every hour, for an entire day, until the target either fails the saving throw or manages to find the infusion and either destroy it or get rid of it.
Once the command has been issued and the target failed the saving throw, this infusion will automatically shut down.

optionalfeature.name: Timely Interference
entries: {@i Students fled with their research as Tolaria fell to the Phyrexians.}
You may take the Dodge action as a bonus action this turn by expending 1 charge. This item has 3 charges, and it recovers 1 charge at the break of dawn.

feat.name: Fires of Victory
entries: {@i The drums and horns were expected, but the goblin dance was a pleasant surprise.}

You dance incessantly to distract your enemies from what's truly important. As a bonus action, you may start dancing in an attempt to charm a creature within 30 feet of you. It must roll a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If it fails, it's charmed. The magical energy flowing from your rhythmical dance will take over the enemy, and, while charmed this way, it will have to spend one of its actions dancing. Additionally, its other actions must be directed at you if possible, no matter what they are meant for.
The dance lasts one minute, or until you lose concentration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the charmed condition ends on the target.
You may use the Fires of Victory dance a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

feat.name: Creepy
entries: {@i Being ugly and weird can be useful sometimes..}
You gain proficiency in intimidation skill, if you already had it, it becomes expertise. You add your charisma number by changing the minus sign to plus.

feat.name: Logical Debater
entries: {@i What matters is what is said, not how it is said. Damn bards!!!.}
You gain proficiency in persuasion skill, if you already had it, it becomes expertise. You add your intelligence modifier instead of charisma.
If, in some way, you use the knowledge gained by feat keen mind, you gain advantage on the roll.

feat.name: Silver Vow of the Deathseeker

prerequisite.other: The ability to cast {@spell Find Familiar|Phb} and 8th level.

entries: Increase your Intelligence, wisdom or charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You have learnt to accept death, not just as in one's passing but as a rule of nature, Through acceptance, comes understanding, and with understanding, aprecciation. This aprecciation has not led you to desire death, but to aprecciate its happening, and because of that, to learn a ritual so you and a forlorn soul may gaze upon death in all its glory.

Through passionate study or any other means, you have learnt to shape the ritual of find familiar to better suit your tastes. When you cast find familiar, you may change its material cost to 50 gold pieces worth of charcoal, fine incense littered with silver powder and ashes of the deceased, alongside presenting the fresh corpse of a crow, or any other similarly characteristic animal representing death and finally reciting a vow to bind the soul of the Deathseeker alongside your own.
By realizing find familiar this way, you shape the body used to one of a {@creature Deathseeker | CS}, which usual shape is that of a Crow with white, glowing eyes.

The Deathseeker's appearance may be molded by you as long as it remains in size, if it lacks wings, it may simply float magically. Its personality also is molded to fit your view of death itself, a view that encapsulates the explosive finality of a warrior's death might have a personality just as bombastic, while a view that views it as serene rest might be calmer and resigned. A Deathseeker may speak any languages you know or just understand them, as per your choice.
The Deathseeker Familiar has its own stat block below, and otherwise posesses the same abilities as a normal familiar. If your Deathseeker dies, it may be restored as any other familiar.

feat.name: Soul-Piercing Giga-Drill
entries: You were built for one purpose, to dig through anything, be it earth, rock or flesh. Once per long rest, you may spend a free action to enter bulldoze mode, you stow away any weapons or shield you were carrying, One of your hands becomes a bulldozing tool, be it as your hand starts spinning insanely fast on your wrist axis or mounts up to become a drill, which counts as a natural weapon with 1d8 piercing damage with the special property.

During bulldoze mode, if you grapple a creature you may attempt to melee attack it with your bulldozing tool, which will deal more consecutive damage after each hit, starting as a 1d8, then a 1d10 at second hit, and finally a d12 for each subsequent hit, as you shove your bulldozing tool down another creature with faster and faster spinning power. A grappled creature that has been hit has disadvantage to escape from your grapple until the end of their next turn, and if any effect might move them away, you may attempt  a strength check against the effect save DC, if applicable, to maintain the grappled in place.
Starting at 6th level, your attacks with your bulldoze tool count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Bulldoze mode lasts one minute, you may deactivate it with a free action and you cannot use other weapons or spells that require a somatic component during it.

feat.name: Exhaust Core
entries: Your core has built in exhaustion vents that help fan out your exerted energies and then replenish them, once per long rest you may spend a bonus action to heal an amount of health equal to 1d8 + your level and one level of exhaustion.

feat.name: Integrated Weapon
entries: When taking this feat, you may choose from two effects:.

items: {@b (A)} Your body gains a natural weapon that is sheathed in one of your limbs, it has the finesse property, you are proficient with it, 5 feet of reach and deals 1d8 of either slashing, piercing or bludgeoning damage, chosen when you select this feat, and additionally, when you do, you may choose for your natural weapon to either gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls or to have 10 feet of reach.

{@b (B)} You integrate a choice weapon that you are proficient with into your body, making sure it is always available for combat, a magic weapon retains its properties and a mundane one becomes unbreakable, as if it were magic. You may use a free action to sheathe or unsheathe your integrated weapon, and it gains special properties depending on where it is integrated. If it is built into one of your arms, after you are attacked you may use your reaction to retaliate, attacking once.

entries: If it is built into your legs, after landing a successful hit, you may gain an extra 10-ft of movement during your turn. You may use these abilities an amount of time equal to your proficiency modifier, you regain the uses after finishing either a long or short rest.

After choosing this feat, you may ask an artificer ( or do it yourself, for half the price if you are an artificer ) to either replace your integrated weapon with a mundane one for 5 GP, switch your integrated weapon’s position from an arm to a leg for 5 GP, or replace a magic weapon for 20 GP.

feat.name: Self-Loving Machine
entries: Your core has built in exhaustion vents that help fan out your exerted energies and then replenish them, once per long rest you may spend a bonus action to heal an amount of health equal to 1d8 + your level and one level of exhaustion.

items: You may detach any part of your body at will.
When you throw a weapon with the thrown property, you may also detach and throw your hand, which will fly back and snap back into place along with the thrown weapon at the start of your next turn.
You can disassemble yourself into smaller parts and reassemble yourself at another location, you count yourself as one size smaller when trying to pass through tight openings.

A friendly creature can use an action to throw your detached torso ( or wherever your core is ) for an amount of feet equal to their strength modifier x 10, you can then call back your body parts which will snap onto place on the next turn.

feat.name: Tear Asunder
entries: No one knew why the spiritmongers were so enraged by Phyrexian technology, but it was a stroke of good luck for the Coalition.
You deal double damage to objects and structures. Additionally, whenever you attack a non-magical object or structure, you have advantage.
You are able to destroy magical objects and structures by attacking them, as long as they aren't Artifacts.

feat.name: Brain Cracker
entries: You have a built in emergency weapon, you can use your action to wind up and fire a colossal laser, roll a d4 to determine its potency, you gain exhaustion equal to the number rolled. The laser travels a l60-ft long and 10-ft line, hitting any creature in the way, forcing them to make a DEX saving throw equal to your CON modifier + 10 + proficiency bonus or take an amount of d6’s worth of damage equal to the number rolled on the D4 x 4, on a success they take half the damage. This feature can only be used once a day, recovering when you are not exhausted anymore.

feat.name: Death Ray
entries: You have a built in emergency weapon, you can use your action to wind up and fire a colossal laser, roll a d4 to determine its potency, you gain exhaustion equal to the number rolled. The laser travels a l60-ft long and 10-ft line, hitting any creature in the way, forcing them to make a DEX saving throw equal to your CON modifier + 10 + proficiency bonus or take an amount of d6’s worth of damage equal to the number rolled on the D4 x 4, on a success they take half the damage. This feature can only be used once a day, recovering when you are not exhausted anymore.

feat.name: Tail Swipe
entries: You've witnessed a dinosaur, and the power those mighty beasts carry with their earth-shaking strides. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You are able to manifest a Tyrannosaurus Rex tail as a bonus action. You use your Strength modifier and add your proficiency to roll for attack, and if it hits, you deal 3d8 + (STR) bludgeoning damage. You can manifest this tail no matter what form you have taken with Wild Shape.

If a creature moves past you in a range of 10 ft., or if you move past a creature within the same range, you may unleash your tail as a bonus action and attempt to make them trip. Roll an attack with the tail, and if it hits, the creature takes half the damage and becomes prone.

feat.name: Rona's Vortex
entries: Whenever you are targeted by a ranged spell attack, you may open a purple, electric vortex in front of you to absorb the attack. Choose a friendly creature within 30 ft. of you. Another vortex will open in front of them, and they will become the new target of the spell, automatically taking the damage you were supposed to take.

Once you do this to a creature, they are considered hostile, and cannot be targeted again. You can use this feat a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and you regain all expended uses on a long rest.

feat.name: Protect the Negotiators
entries: As a reaction, whenever a creature within a distance equal to your available walking speed of you is targeted for an attack, you may move up to it and defend it with your shield, forcing the attacking creature to target you instead.

feat.name: Joint Exploration
entries: {@i The Tolarians had the maps, but only the Yavimayans knew how to read them.}
Choose a favored environment among these: Sylvan Forest, Urban, Undersea, At Sea, Arctic, Coastal, Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark, Underwater, Wildspace, Astral Sea.

You may take short and long rests while exploring difficult terrains in your favored environment. You may engage in tough activities, such as fighting, at least once without interrupting your rest. Additionally, while inside the environment, you have advantage in Perception and Investigation checks to find creatures, structures and items, advantage on Stealth checks and an extra 10 feet of movement
You may take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different environment. Your DM may add or remove possible environments from this list.

feat.name: Breaker of Light
entries: To bathe all in gross incandescence and to spread the warmth of sunlight to all,  you've learnt that a few walls must me tore down to let the light in.
You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: All Encompassing
entries: While bathed in natural or magical sunlight, you feel yourself invigorated to much like the sun, withstand everything so your light may shine again, once per day you can use a reaction, which you take when an attack would reduce you to below one hit point, to instead retain a single hit point instead.

entries.name: Solar Rebuttal
entries: Much like the sun, any who dares disrespect its warmth and get to close, you burn those who dare wound you. As a reaction, which you take when another creature within reach attacks you, you may make one weapon attacked against said creature, dealing an additional +2 damage to said attack as appropriate for your weapons damage type. You can do this an amount of times equal to your proficiency modifier, which your regain at daybreak.

feat.name: Moment of Respite
entries: You've travelled a lot as an adventurer, and for sure saw and will see a great many variety of places, but theres always a favorite that resonates within your heart. Pick one of these selected environments as your favoured environment.

items: Arctic
Coast
Desert
Forest
Grassland
Mountain
Swamp

entries: Whenever you have a long rest in this environment, you can't help but be relieved by what surrounds you, gaining temporary hit points equal to your level until your next long rest, besides that, after resting in your favoured environment you gain proficiency in nature to checks that relate to this specific environment, such as recognizing a yeti in an Arctic environment. If you are already proficient in nature, treat it as expertise instead.

feat.name: Flowstone Infusion
entries: {@i The rumor that contact with flowstone would reveal Phyrexian sleeper agents was spread mostly by Phyrexian sleeper agents.}
Once per turn, if your attack hits, you may spend a number of hit dice up to half your current level. You take half of the damage, but add the total amount as extra damage on your attack.

feat.name: Ertai's Scorn
entries: {@i You're not so special, Karn. Anything that has been assembled can be disassembled.}

Whenever you touch a mechanical item or structure that is large or smaller, you may magically disassemble it in a process which lasts 1 minute. You automatically are made of aware of every piece inside of the item or structure, but not necessarily what their purposes are, unless you are an Artificer. If the item or structure is magical, you must a second level spell slot or higher to utilize this feat on it.

Living Constructs are considered magical and aren't automatically disassembled, they must make a constitution saving throw against your spell save DC; on a failed save, they take 3d10 force damage as you try to force their body apart, the damage increases by 1d10 for each new attempt. The base damage is 4d10 if you are an artificer.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and you regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

feat.name: Heroic Charge
entries: {@i For Keld! For Benalia! For Dominaria!}

Your martial training in New Benalia has taught you how to rush straight into battle. Once per round, if you run over 20 feet towards a target and strike them with a melee weapon attack, you may add an extra 1d6 damage to the attack, the damage type is based on your weapon's damage.
The target must then make an Athletics or Acrobatics ability check contested by an Athletics ability check from you. If the target fails, it falls prone.
You can use this feat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses with a long rest.

feat.name: Artillery Blast
entries: {@i To conserve ammunition, Jhoira modified ancient Thran artillery cannons to fire gouts of pure Shivan lava.}

Your cannons can now be medium in size. Once you create a cannon, you can't do so again until you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. You can have two cannons at a time and can't create more than two while your other cannons are present.
Friendly creatures within 5 feet of one of your cannons may operate it with their bonus action, as long as you allow them to.
On a critical hit, your cannons will deal 2d10 instead of 2d8 fire damage.

feat.name: Twinferno
entries: {@i “More fire?” Jaya asked.}
{@i “More fire.” Jodah agreed.}

You are able to utilize the Twinned Spell Metamagic feat as a reaction when a willing creature within 30 ft. of you casts a spell. You grant that creature the same effects of your Twinned Spell, spending the same necessary amount of sorcery points.

feat.name: Warhost's Frenzy
entries: {@i Keldons may be outnumbered, but they are never outmatched.}

Immediately after you kill a creature, you may use your reaction to attack another creature within 5 feet of you. If none are within reach, you let out a battle cry, and another creature of your choice within 30 ft. of you may attack a creature within their range.

feat.name: Furious Bellow
entries: {@i Minotaurs sometimes pretend to be lost in a battle rage, leading their opponents to underestimate their cleverness.}
You unleah a strong shout to confuse your enemy, showcasing your true battle experience once your attack connects..

items: Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn, as a bonus action, you may release a powerful bellow, targeting a creature within 30 ft. of you. Roll an Intimidation ability check against the target, you may use your Strength modifier if it is higher than your Charisma. The target must roll a Wisdom saving throw against your Intimidation check. If it fails, the next time you would hit it with an attack, it strikes with great accuracy, dealing an added 1d6 damage. The target also becomes Frightened of you, whether the attack hit or not. Once a target fails or succeeds in this roll, they are immune to this effect for 1 hour.

feat.name: Hurloon Battle Hymn
entries: The magical echoes of the Hurloon mountain range greatly increase the potency of spells based on song or speech.

You gain the ability to sing a Hurloon battle hymn. As a bonus action, you may start singing. This song does not affect the verbal components of your spells. Any creature of your choice within 30 feet of you are empowered by the song. Choose one:

items: The empowered creatures receive a 1d4 bonus to any saving throws or attack rolls they make. Additionally, they add 1d4 thunder damage to their attack if it hits. If the attack was already thunder damage, then they deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage.
The empowered creatures' spells with the verbal component are able to be cast one level higher without spending a spell slot of that higher level.

entries: The Hurloon battle hymn requires concentration, similar to a spell. After you've sang the Hurloon battle hymn, you may only do so again after a short or long rest.

feat.name: Familiar of Holding
entries: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You have learned new intricacies regarding to your spell formula about familiars, and because of that, you learnt how to connect your familiar to a tiny demi-plane where you both can stash items. This plane's entrance is as big as your familiars size, with it being able to actually store items either by eating them and sending them through a portal in its belly, or conjuring it outright.
The demi-plane can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

Only you, your familiar or authorized personnel may retrieve items using an action. If your familiar is killed or you lose connection to it, the items remain in the demi-plane until you are bonded with another familiar or revive it. A tiny creature can be shoved inside the dimension, but can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

feat.name: Strength of the Coalition

entries: {@i Root and wing, claw and sword; this will be a memorable stand, indeed.}
You're a member of the Coalition, the group of Dominarians that have sworn to fight for their plane. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Strength, Constitution, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least two of your allies are within 5 feet of the creature and the allies aren't incapacitated.

You are able to aid nearby allies, joining together in their attacks to combo against your enemies. As a reaction to when an ally's attack roll hits, you may change their damage type to any non-physical damage type you're able to inflict, as well as add 1d6 damage of the chosen type to the damage roll as you strike against your enemy together..

entries: (!) A member of the Coalition is any character that is fighting against the Phyrexians, no matter who or where they are.
